results.title: The Secret of Roan Inish
results.creator_credit: Peter Newman Productions, Sarah Green, Maggie Renzi and John Sayles
results.brief_description: The Coneelly family, now living on the isolated west coast of Ireland, has been displaced from Roan Inish, the small, mysterious island which they shared with herds of seals. Fiona is sent to live there with her grandparents and becomes determined to penetrate the secrets of her family’s mysterious past and the legends they all embrace. Cast includes Mick Lally, Eileen Colgan, John Lynch and Jeni Courtney.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh 2: Timmy to the rescue
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Paul Sabella, Jonathan Dern and Dick Sebast
results.brief_description: Jonathan Brisby, the bravest of all rats died in saving his fellow creatures from the evil clutches of NIMH. Once escaped, the rats made a home for themselves in Thorn Valley. It was predicted that one day the forces of NIMH would rise again and the son of Jonathan Brisby would save them; the destiny of rats lies with Timmy Brisby. Feeling the pressure to be the hero his father was, Timmy begins his journey with Jeremy the crow where he is placed under the tutelage of Mr Ages and fellow elders who equip him with the tools to face his destiny. A female rat called Jenny makes it to the village and implores them to return to NIMH with her and save the rats from the evil Doctor Valentine. The council decides against helping her however, and when Timmy discovers elder brother Martin is a prisoner at NIMH, he and Jenny decide to save the rats themselves. Made for television 16 years after the original and features musical numbers. Features the voices of Dom DeLuise, Eric Idle, Ralph Macchio, William H. Macy and Hynden Walch. Narrated by Peter MacNicoll.

results.title: The Secret of Nimh [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Aurora, Don Bluth and Gary Goldman
results.brief_description: The story of timid Mrs Brisby, a widowed field mouse who must summon the courage to defy man, beast and nature against the imminent destruction of her home before Farmer Fitzgibbon’s spring plowing. With the help of love-sick Jeremy the crow and the mysterious rats of NIMH (super intelligent creatures residing in the farmer’s rosebush), she finds the strength to overcome the obstacles that threaten her family. Based on the story by Robert C. O’Brien.

results.title: The Secret life of Walter Mitty
results.brief_description: Walter Mitty is a dreamer. To escape the humdrum of his life and his shrewish mother, Walter’s secret life is rich and exciting by comparison. Walter’s daydream personnas include a western gunslinger, a world-famous surgeon, a RAF pilot and a Mississippi river boat gambler. A mysterious and beautiful blonde is always by his side. Suddenly Walter is thrust into a real-life adventure when he comes to the rescue of a ravishing blonde trying to escape a gang of jewel thieves. Danny Kaye brings all his comic genius into the role of Walter Mitty and is supported by Boris Karloff and Virginia Mayo. Based on the renown short story by James Thurber, this is a comic fantasy which can be enjoyed by all.

results.title: The Searchers [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Merian C. Cooper and John Ford
results.brief_description: Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) resolves to find his niece, abducted by Indians at the close of the Civil War. It is an odyssey which takes five years, by the end of which he plans to take revenge on the Indians for the friends and family he has lost. John Ford used sumptuous Monument Valley as a background for this his most poetic and complex western. Cast includes Vera Miles and a young Natalie Wood. Based on a novel by Alan Le May. A documentary written and directed by Nick Redman entitled, “A Turning of the earth: John Ford, John Wayne and ‘The Searchers’”, featuring outtakes, home movies and the original theatrical trailer precedes the film. Introduced by Patrick Wayne.

results.title: The Scent of green papaya = l'odeur de la papaye verte
results.creator_credit: Productions Lazennec, SFP Cinema, La Sept Cinema, Christophe Rossignon and Tran Anh Hung
results.brief_description: Vietnam, 1950. Mui, a young country girl, joins a Saigon family as their servant and develops an enduring but secret attachment to Khuyen (Vuong Hoa Hoi), a friend of the eldest son. Some years later, when the family fortune declines and they can no longer afford to keep her, Mui (Nu Yen-Khe Tran), now 20, is sent to serve in the household of her childhood love who has now become a successful musician. Shot entirely in a French studio, Hung’s film is more concerned with the minute details of everyday Vietnamese life and the tones, colors, and feelings of a lost society. Hung casted non-professional actors, mostly Vietnamese living in Paris, who had to re-learn certain ritual gestures and Vietnamese language. His approach to this gentle world is reminiscent of Satyajit Ray and Ozu. He nudges the film forward by subtle, quiet strokes. Awards: French Academy of Cinema (1993): best First Feature Film for Tran Anh Hung ; Cannes Film Festival: Camera d’Or for Best First Film. Cast includes Nu Yen-Khe Tran, Truong Thi Loc and Nguyen Anh Hoa. In Vietnamese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
results.brief_description: In the early days of the French Revolution, a mysterious flower-brandishing Englishman, known affectionately and notoriously as the Scarlet Pimpernel, is leading a daring band in the timely rescue of aristocrats from the guillotine. Unbeknown to his beautiful French wife the Scarlet Pimpernel is, in reality, none other than Sir Percy Blakeney who feigns poetry-reading foppishness as his disguise. Based on the popular romantic novel by Baroness Orczy, a richly detailed historical background and splendid plot make “The Scarlet Pimpernel” a first-class period adventure. Stars Leslie Howard and Merle Oberon. Rated: G

results.title: The Scarlet pimpernel
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions, David Conroy and Clive Donner
results.brief_description: Sir Percy Blakeney, Baronet, alias “The Scarlett Pimpernel” was the literary creation of Baronet Orczy. Sir Percy’s escapades during the French Revolution, where he and his band of young English noblemen risk life and limb to rescue the ‘aristos’ from the clutches of the guillotine, are vividly brought to life in this film made for television. Anthony Andrews is the dashing and elegant Sir Percy, Jane Seymour plays his lovely French wife Marguerite and Ian McKellen is Chauvelin, Sir Percy’s arch enemy. The costumes are sumptuous and the dialogue witty.
